item.title: How Intuition Fuels Business Agility
item.description:
How Intuition Fuels Business Agility

Long-term declines in many industries have forced companies to make fundamental changes in how they understand, anticipate, and partner with their customers. However, many companies are mistaking frenzy for change and "more of the same" for innovation, as is evidenced by continual churn, reorgs, and the continued failure rate of new products.

item.title: MIT's Innovation Dean on 3 Big Predictions for the Future of Technology
item.description:
MIT's Innovation Dean on 3 Big Predictions for the Future of Technology

If you could learn about innovation from an entrepreneur who holds more than 85 patents--and is the co-founder of three promising nanotechnology startups with a combined 200 employees--you'd probably jump on that chance. Especially if that entrepreneur also happened to be an MIT professor.

item.title: What Content Types Should You Create? [Infographic]
item.description:
What Content Types Should You Create? [Infographic]

What's happening in content marketing? For starters, an overwhelming percentage of companies is doing content marketing. We know this from the annual research that Content Marketing Institute, MarketingProfs, and their partners conduct for both B2B and B2C, and present annually as Benchmarks, Budgets, and Trends.

item.title: Choosing the Best Blog Topic: 11 Simple Tactics
item.description:
Choosing the Best Blog Topic: 11 Simple Tactics

Being faithful to a blogging schedule is a tough job. And it gets worse if you hit writer's block. At a certain point, the only question on your mind is, " What am I going to write about?"

item.title: Eye-Tracking Study: How Consumers View Display Ads
item.description:
Eye-Tracking Study: How Consumers View Display Ads

Do consumers actually notice online display ads served on Web pages? Which format of ads do people look at and engage with the most? To find out, Meditative conducted an eye-tracking study of 39 participants of mixed ages who were assigned certain search tasks.

item.title: 15 Digital Marketing Trends for 2016 That Could Destroy Your Business
item.description:
15 Digital Marketing Trends for 2016 That Could Destroy Your Business

Marketing today is a new game. The "Mad Men" of the Madison avenue era of wine, whisky and women as inspiration, are now a distant but fond memory. But as much as the new dawn of digital and the rise of the social web have changed the landscape, some things have stayed the same.

item.title: The Ultimate Guide to Social Proof Marketing
item.description:
The Ultimate Guide to Social Proof Marketing

Just think about it: How often do you pick a restaurant based solely on the number of people dining inside? Buy a product based on a number of customers who have allegedly purchased it already? Or hire a particular service provider just because they have more positive reviews?
